What profession did Leo Bonhart have bef: Leo Bonhart, before his career as a bounty hunter, served as a professional soldier hailing from Ebbing. He was recognized for his professionalism, and his services were costly. His appearance was marked by his towering height, thin physique, grey moustache, and cold, fish-like eyes. Additionally, he owned three witcher medallions.
What physical characteristics make Leo B: Leo Bonhart, a former professional soldier turned bounty hunter, is distinguished by his tall, thin physique and large grey moustache. His eyes, cold and devoid of expression, are often compared to a fishs gaze. He also carries three witcher medallions as part of his persona.
What significance do the three witcher m: Leo Bonharts three witcher medallions, portraying a wolf, a cat, and a griffin, signify the witcher schools of their former owners. Bonharts possession of these medallions underscores his combat prowess, as he alleges to have slain their previous witcher owners, known for their resilience. Post Bonharts demise, the cat medallion was claimed by Ciri, who also gifted the wolf medallion to Geralt.
What is the meaning behind the wolf and: Bounty hunter Leo Bonhart held three witcher medallions, each symbolizing a different witcher school: wolf, cat, and griffin. These medallions were trophies, evidencing his martial skill, as he alleged to have slain their prior witcher owners. Each medallions form signifies the school of its original owner. Post Bonharts demise, Ciri took the cat medallion, passed the wolf one to Geralt, while the griffin medallions fate is unclear.
